result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica L. BIEBER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 8-6-2015 at 11 a.m., Br. 3

Defendant in custody.    
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 06-23-15 at 11:00 a.m.   Plea date is set for 08-06-15 at 11:00 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
BAIL MOTION
Counsel argue.  Court modifies defendant's bail to $1,500.00 cash with the additional condition of daily report, by noon, to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail. 
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 06-03-15 at 3:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of bail jumping and deliver cocaine within 1000 feet of park.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-01-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with Kendrick Miller and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
